intro: Bartsia anomala, commonly known as the narrowleaf bartsia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Bartsia anomala produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer.
